            <title>[VALIDATOR-482] ISBN validator validates false for existing book</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-482</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;For instance the following ISBN number exists but the validator returns false:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;978-0199828234&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://www.worldcat.org/search?q=978-0199828234&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://www.worldcat.org/search?q=978-0199828234&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>

                            <comment id="17401758" author="homebeaver" created="Thu, 19 Aug 2021 17:04:45 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=paulspeijers&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;paulspeijers&quot;&gt;Paul Speijers&lt;/a&gt;,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;the format you use is not valid for the validator.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&quot;978-0-19-982823-4&quot;, // see Attachment&lt;br/&gt;
 &quot;978 0 19 982823 4&quot;,&lt;br/&gt;

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-480] Email Validator should not allow the local part to start or end with a dot</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-480</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Email Validator&#160;should not allow local part (user part) to start or end with a dot also dots.&#160; Also a double dot is not allowed.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;br/&gt;
Copied from Email Address wiki:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;dot&#160;&lt;tt&gt;.&lt;/tt&gt;, provided that it is not the first or last character and provided also that it does not appear consecutively (e.g.,&#160;&lt;tt&gt;John..Doe@example.com&lt;/tt&gt;&#160;is not allowed).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;br/&gt;
Below is from rfc3696:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Without quotes, local-parts may consist of any combination of&lt;br/&gt;
 alphabetic characters, digits, or any of the special characters&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;! # $ % &amp;amp; &apos; * + - / = ? ^ _ ` . { | } ~&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;period (&quot;.&quot;) may also appear, but may not be used to start or end the&lt;br/&gt;
 local part, nor may two or more consecutive periods appear. Stated&lt;br/&gt;
 differently, any ASCII graphic (printing) character other than the&lt;br/&gt;
 at-sign (&quot;@&quot;), backslash, double quote, comma, or square brackets may&lt;br/&gt;
 appear without quoting. If any of that list of excluded characters&lt;br/&gt;
 are to appear, they must be quoted.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13386902">VALIDATOR-480</key>
            <summary>Email Validator should not allow the local part to start or end with a dot</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="8">Not A Problem</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="joe.knudsen@gmail.com">Joe Knudsen</reporter>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-478] In the latest version 1.7 the UrlValidator is giving the result as Invalid for some of the Urls which were valid in version 1.6</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-478</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The following URL which I have specified is coming as InValid URL according to Commons-validator latest version 1.7&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://checkoutshopper-live.adyen.com/checkoutshopper/3dnotif.shtml?originKey=pub.v2.###MAASKED#####0012.aHR0cHM6Ly9jaGVja291dHNob3BwZXItbGl2ZS5hZHllbi5jb20.FRf3zC99VPpJ8Eg1gNYaiR_PxMLPZfWnHWc6uYhbyNw&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://checkoutshopper-live.adyen.com/checkoutshopper/3dnotif.shtml?originKey=pub.v2.###MAASKED#####0012.aHR0cHM6Ly9jaGVja291dHNob3BwZXItbGl2ZS5hZHllbi5jb20.FRf3zC99VPpJ8Eg1gNYaiR_PxMLPZfWnHWc6uYhbyNw&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;where this URL was valid when I validated with version 1.6&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Please help me out why this has happened? if the above URL specified is really invalid please specify the reason.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13342582">VALIDATOR-478</key>
            <summary>In the latest version 1.7 the UrlValidator is giving the result as Invalid for some of the Urls which were valid in version 1.6</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="8">Not A Problem</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="ss667511">Sunil kumar S</reporter>
                        <labels>
                            <label>features</label>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 25 Nov 2020 10:51:10 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sat, 2 Jan 2021 15:31:16 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Sat, 2 Jan 2021 15:31:16 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.7</version>
                                                    <component>Routines</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="17257410" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Sat, 2 Jan 2021 15:31:16 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The code now uses java.net.URI to parse the string, see &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-472&quot; title=&quot;UrlValidator should not be more lax than java.net.URI&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;VALIDATOR-472&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;VALIDATOR-472&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt;, and the URL is not valid as far as Java is concerned (looks like a fragment is not allowed to contain a #).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;You will need to escape the invalid characters.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>
                    </attachments>
                <subtasks>
                    </subtasks>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-472] UrlValidator should not be more lax than java.net.URI</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-472</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;UrlValidator should ensure that valid URLs are also valid as far as java.net.URI is concerned.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;i.e. if java.net.URI fails to parse the URL, it should not be considered valid.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The validator still needs to do additional checks, e.g. to limit which schemes are allowed.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13319621">VALIDATOR-472</key>
            <summary>UrlValidator should not be more lax than java.net.URI</summary>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-471] Allow DomainValidator overrides at run-time</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-471</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;It would be useful to allow DomainValidator instances to be created with different overrides.&lt;br/&gt;
Currently this is not possible because there are only two cached instances.&lt;br/&gt;
As such, it&apos;s not possible to make changes after initialisation.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The class could be extended allow further instances to be created, whilst still keeping the existing behaviour for the cached instances.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This would allow users to create further instances with local changes to the Generic and CountryCode lists.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13319316">VALIDATOR-471</key>
            <summary>Allow DomainValidator overrides at run-time</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-470] EmailValidator does not recognize IP-Adresses</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-470</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;email@123.123.123.123&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;is considered an invalid. This is not correct.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Strangely &quot;email@&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;123.123.123.123&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&quot; is considered to be valid...&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13318693">VALIDATOR-470</key>
            <summary>EmailValidator does not recognize IP-Adresses</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="6">Invalid</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="tom_1st">Lonzak</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 22 Jul 2020 12:05:12 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 27 Jul 2020 13:52:00 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Sun, 26 Jul 2020 14:13:43 +0000</resolved>
                                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="17165226" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Sun, 26 Jul 2020 14:13:43 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;123.123.123.123 is not valid as a hostname; the path segments must start with a letter according to RFC 1035.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However email@&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;123.123.123.123&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; is valid, because that uses the domain literal format:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5321#section-4.1.3&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5321#section-4.1.3&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17165496" author="tom_1st" created="Mon, 27 Jul 2020 07:21:17 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Ok but according to rfc2822 it is a valid domain name.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17165728" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Mon, 27 Jul 2020 13:52:00 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;hostname is not the same as domain name&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-469] Domain validator is not up to date with latest TLD (Top Level domain) list</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-469</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The Domain validator (TLD) list is not to up to date in the framework src code. We are using commons validator to verify the URL schema and the email validation in our project.&#160; I&apos;m dealing with a production issue due to this, client is sending a domain in the url,email in the request which is not in the list of commons-validator.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The domain in the URL we received is,&#160; http://blah.&lt;font color=&quot;#de350b&quot;&gt;&lt;b&gt;sport.&lt;/b&gt;&#160; &#160;the validation returned error for this domain.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt; then look at the code and figured that this particular domain (sport) is missing from your list.&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Latest TLD, I found in internet.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://data.iana.org/TLD/tlds-alpha-by-domain.txt&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://data.iana.org/TLD/tlds-alpha-by-domain.txt&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;src-code link&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-validator/apidocs/src-html/org/apache/commons/validator/routines/DomainValidator.html&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-validator/apidocs/src-html/org/apache/commons/validator/routines/DomainValidator.html&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Production build&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="13314367">VALIDATOR-469</key>
            <summary>Domain validator is not up to date with latest TLD (Top Level domain) list</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>

                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-468] DomainValidator.getTLDArray does not synch mutable arrays</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-468</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The method DomainValidator.getTLDEntries is currently unsynchronized.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This means that there may be issues with the contents of the mutable override arrays.&lt;br/&gt;
Although the arrays are marked volatile, that does not protect the array entries.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Note: although #isValid() is not synchronised, this can only be used after calling a synchronised getInstance.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;AFAICT there is no point in leaving the arrays volatile.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13312686">VALIDATOR-468</key>
            <summary>DomainValidator.getTLDArray does not synch mutable arrays</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="sebb">Sebb</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Sun, 21 Jun 2020 13:22:07 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sat, 8 Aug 2020 11:55:39 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Sun, 21 Jun 2020 16:27:03 +0000</resolved>
                                                    <fixVersion>1.7</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>

                                    <watches>0</watches>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-467] URL validator fails if path starts with double slash and has underscores</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-467</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; org.apache.commons.validator.routines.UrlValidator;
...
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;private&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;[] schemes = {&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;http&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;https&quot;&lt;/span&gt;};
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;private&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; UrlValidator urlValidator = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; UrlValidator(schemes,
        UrlValidator.ALLOW_LOCAL_URLS + UrlValidator.ALLOW_2_SLASHES);
...
urlValidator.isValid(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;https:&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;//example.com//some_path/path/&quot;&lt;/span&gt;)&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This returns &lt;tt&gt;false&lt;/tt&gt;. However such URL is valid if authority is not &lt;tt&gt;null&lt;/tt&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The reason it returns &lt;tt&gt;false&lt;/tt&gt; is this code in the validator:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-validator/blob/a3771313c9f1833abf32c7c294ad1de4810e532d/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/validator/routines/UrlValidator.java#L452-L461&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-validator/blob/a3771313c9f1833abf32c7c294ad1de4810e532d/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/validator/routines/UrlValidator.java#L452-L461&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;try&lt;/span&gt; {
            URI uri = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; URI(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;,&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;,path,&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;);
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; norm = uri.normalize().getPath();
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (norm.startsWith(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;/../&quot;&lt;/span&gt;) &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// Trying to go via the parent dir 
&lt;/span&gt;             || norm.equals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;/..&quot;&lt;/span&gt;)) {   &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// Trying to go to the parent dir
&lt;/span&gt;                &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;false&lt;/span&gt;;
            }
        } &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;catch&lt;/span&gt; (URISyntaxException e) {
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;false&lt;/span&gt;;
        }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;As far as I understand &lt;tt&gt;URI uri = new URI(null,null,path,null);&lt;/tt&gt; throws &lt;tt&gt;URISyntaxException&lt;/tt&gt; if authority is &lt;tt&gt;null&lt;/tt&gt; and path starts with &lt;tt&gt;//&lt;/tt&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I tried running &lt;tt&gt;new URI(null, &quot;example.com&quot;, path, null);&lt;/tt&gt; and it worked.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I didn&apos;t read RFC but from some googling around I got the following:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;//some_path&lt;/tt&gt; is invalid if authority is null&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;tt&gt;//some_path&lt;/tt&gt; is valid if authority is not null&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;b&gt;Update:&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Another thing I noticed while testing is that the following actually passes the validation &#8211; &lt;tt&gt;&quot;https://example.com//test&quot;&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
And that &lt;tt&gt;&quot;https://example.com//test_test&quot;&lt;/tt&gt; fails the validation but &lt;tt&gt;URISyntaxException&lt;/tt&gt; is thrown due to &lt;tt&gt;Illegal character in hostname&lt;/tt&gt; and not due to &lt;tt&gt;//&lt;/tt&gt; at the start.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So my original theory behind the failure looks incorrect now, however I still consider this bug as a valid one.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I guess better description would be &quot;URL validator incorrectly uses URI uri = new URI(null,null,path,null); check. Due to these nulls in arguments path is validated as a hostname&quot;.&lt;br/&gt;
And the simplest URL to test is &lt;tt&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://example.com//test_double_slash_and_underscore&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://example.com//test_double_slash_and_underscore&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13307819">VALIDATOR-467</key>
            <summary>URL validator fails if path starts with double slash and has underscores</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="ilarionov">Ivan Larionov</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 27 May 2020 18:19:31 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sat, 8 Aug 2020 11:55:51 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Fri, 19 Jun 2020 21:09:10 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.6</version>
                                    <fixVersion>1.7</fixVersion>
                                    <component>Routines</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>1</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="17140833" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Fri, 19 Jun 2020 21:09:10 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Good catch&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Fixed with &lt;font color=&quot;#222222&quot;&gt;e9bda17e9a27e4e8d1b951854baf83&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font color=&quot;#222222&quot;&gt;8f0075619f&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17166648" author="ilarionov" created="Tue, 28 Jul 2020 19:18:19 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This bug was a huge blocker for us. I&apos;m glad it was fixed pretty fast, but are there any plans for a new release of &lt;tt&gt;commons-validator&lt;/tt&gt;?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-466] An update is needed of generic TLDS in DomainValidator</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-466</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;I have been using UrlValidator to check some urls and recently have some problems with some domains with new gTLDs such as &quot;.inc&quot; which would be determined as invalid.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I noticed that there was a commit to it which contains &quot;.inc&quot; already, so maybe all I need is a release?&lt;/p&gt;

                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-465</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Hello,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;http://foo.com/unicode_(&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://foo.com/unicode_(&lt;/a&gt;&#10026;)_in_parens&lt;/p&gt;

            <title>[VALIDATOR-462] Wrong Isin, validation passed</title>

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

            <title>[VALIDATOR-461] Generic .gmbh top level domain is considered invalid</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-461</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Attempting to validate a url/ top-level-domain like&#160;&lt;a href=&quot;https://test.gmbh/&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://test.gmbh/&lt;/a&gt;&#160;returns that it is invalid when it&apos;s not.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Background information: The top-level-domain requires to demonstrate current or pending designation as a GmbH company whose existence can be validated with the respective public authorities in Austria, Germany, Liechtenstein or Switzerland.&lt;/p&gt;</description>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-457] Email validation is failing when the domain name is &quot;llc&quot; (Limited Liability option)</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-457</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;We are using 1.6 version of the Commons validator. It is working in almost all domains for email validation. We recently started seeing issues, when the email address is in this format - &lt;span class=&quot;nobr&quot;&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;mailto:abc@onedomain.llc&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;abc@onedomain.llc&lt;sup&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;rendericon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/mail_small.gif&quot; height=&quot;12&quot; width=&quot;13&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;. Validator returns this email address as false.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;lt;&lt;b&gt;dependency&lt;/b&gt;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&#160; &amp;lt;&lt;b&gt;groupId&lt;/b&gt;&amp;gt;commons-validator&amp;lt;/&lt;b&gt;groupId&lt;/b&gt;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&#160; &amp;lt;&lt;b&gt;artifactId&lt;/b&gt;&amp;gt;commons-validator&amp;lt;/&lt;b&gt;artifactId&lt;/b&gt;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&#160; &amp;lt;&lt;b&gt;version&lt;/b&gt;&amp;gt;1.6&amp;lt;/&lt;b&gt;version&lt;/b&gt;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
&amp;lt;/&lt;b&gt;dependency&lt;/b&gt;&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I debugged further and found out that in the String array GENERIC_TLDS[] in DomainValidator class, the domain, &quot;llc&quot; is missing. If we add that it should start working.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13233231">VALIDATOR-457</key>
            <summary>Email validation is failing when the domain name is &quot;llc&quot; (Limited Liability option)</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="madancr">Madan Ranganath</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 14 May 2019 12:46:14 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sat, 8 Aug 2020 11:55:46 +0000</updated>

                                                    <fixVersion>1.7</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="16841070" author="michael-o" created="Thu, 16 May 2019 07:48:54 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;It is documented here: &lt;a href=&quot;http://data.iana.org/TLD/tlds-alpha-by-domain.txt&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://data.iana.org/TLD/tlds-alpha-by-domain.txt&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16841081" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Thu, 16 May 2019 08:02:47 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The list of TLDs is always changing, so the code now allows the list to be overridden on startup.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;See updateTLDOverride():&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;a href=&quot;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-validator/apidocs/org/apache/commons/validator/routines/DomainValidator.html#updateTLDOverride(org.apache.commons.validator.routines.DomainValidator.ArrayType,%20java.lang.String[]&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-validator/apidocs/org/apache/commons/validator/routines/DomainValidator.html#updateTLDOverride(org.apache.commons.validator.routines.DomainValidator.ArrayType,%20java.lang.String[]&lt;/a&gt;)&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="17140018" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Thu, 18 Jun 2020 22:11:19 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Fixed in c53e5639b7e149e2ea9efe78a9217afdcf3bbcbd&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-454]  DomainValidator.isvalid(&quot;com&quot;) returns valid</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-454</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The documentation says&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;isValid() Returns true if the specified&#160;&lt;tt&gt;String&lt;/tt&gt;&#160;parses as a valid domain name &lt;b&gt;with a recognized top-level domain&lt;/b&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;br/&gt;
 therefore isValid(&quot;com&quot;)` must return false as there is no top-level domain included in it&lt;br/&gt;
 &#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13218188">VALIDATOR-454</key>
            <summary> DomainValidator.isvalid(&quot;com&quot;) returns valid</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>

                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-453] UrlValidator.isValidPath does not support unicode characters</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-453</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;LinkedIn allows unicode characters such as &#230;&#248;&#229; in their urls, which fails due to the PATH_REGEX using only w&lt;br/&gt;
Old:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;private&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; PATH_REGEX = &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;^(/[-\\w:@&amp;amp;?=+,.!/~*&apos;%$_;\\(\\)]*)?$&quot;&lt;/span&gt;;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;New:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;private&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; PATH_REGEX = &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;^(/[-\\w\\pL:@&amp;amp;?=+,.!/~*&apos;%$_;\\(\\)]*)?$&quot;&lt;/span&gt;;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13212569">VALIDATOR-453</key>
            <summary>UrlValidator.isValidPath does not support unicode characters</summary>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-452] Validation of URL containing IPv4-mapped IPv6 address</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-452</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Hello,&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;UrlValidator.isValid treats url containing ipv4-mapped ipv6 address as invalid. For instance, this is valid url that is returned as invalid by the validator- &quot;http://[::FFFF:129.144.52.38]:80/index.html&quot;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13206358">VALIDATOR-452</key>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-451] Support for .LLC Email addresses</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-451</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The current EmailValidator implementation does not recognize the &quot;.LLC&quot;&#160;TLD in valid email addressed. For instance, EmailValidator.getInstance.isValid(&quot;example@domain.llc&quot;) will return false.&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;.LLC has been a valid TLD as of at least 12/14/2017. &lt;a href=&quot;https://www.icann.org/resources/agreement/llc-2017-12-14-en&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;ICANN Registry Agreement&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13204101">VALIDATOR-451</key>
            <summary>Support for .LLC Email addresses</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-450] EmailValidator : Support new official TLDs</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-450</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;isValid(String email) must return true if the email is valid. &quot;john.doe@my-company.sport&quot; currently returns false.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The new TLDs (ex. .sport) is not recognize because they are missing from the DomainValidator class array GENERIC_TLDS.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13201947">VALIDATOR-450</key>
            <summary>EmailValidator : Support new official TLDs</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/trivial.svg">Trivial</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="10">Implemented</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="Goeschmann">David</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Mon, 3 Dec 2018 10:32:39 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 13 Dec 2018 10:10:45 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Fri, 7 Dec 2018 12:14:53 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.6</version>
                                                    <component>Framework</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="16712766" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Fri, 7 Dec 2018 12:14:53 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The list of TLDs is always changing, so the code now allows the list to be overridden on startup.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;See updateTLDOverride():&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;a href=&quot;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-validator/apidocs/org/apache/commons/validator/routines/DomainValidator.html#updateTLDOverride(org.apache.commons.validator.routines.DomainValidator.ArrayType,%20java.lang.String[&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-validator/apidocs/org/apache/commons/validator/routines/DomainValidator.html#updateTLDOverride(org.apache.commons.validator.routines.DomainValidator.ArrayType,%20java.lang.String[&lt;/a&gt;])&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-449] Leading and trailing spaces in EmailValidator should not be valid</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-449</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;I feel that:&lt;br/&gt;
 EmailValidator.getInstance(true).isValid(&quot; some@email.com &quot;);&lt;br/&gt;
should return false, but the regex used in EmailValidator matches this string. Furthermore, the following user + domain validation is done only on &quot;some&quot; and &quot;email.com&quot;, respectively. This is because the regex captures the user and domain without the space.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I know the documentation states : &quot;This implementation is not guaranteed to catch all possible errors in an email address&quot; but,&#160;I think this case is simple enough to be in the validator.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13200119">VALIDATOR-449</key>
            <summary>Leading and trailing spaces in EmailValidator should not be valid</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-448] Tests failing on trunk</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-448</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Commons Validator has failing tests on&#160;trunk.&#160;The failing tests boils down to this:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
jshell&amp;gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; org.apache.commons.validator.routines.CalendarValidator;
jshell&amp;gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;var&lt;/span&gt; cv = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; CalendarValidator();
jshell&amp;gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;var&lt;/span&gt; i = CalendarValidator.getInstance();
jshell&amp;gt; i.validate(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;31 Dez 2005&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;dd MMM yyyy&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, Locale.GERMAN);
$9 ==&amp;gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;&#8756;java -version&lt;br/&gt;
java version &quot;11&quot; 2018-09-25&lt;br/&gt;
Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment 18.9 (build 11+28)&lt;br/&gt;
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM 18.9 (build 11+28, mixed mode)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#8756;jshell -version&lt;br/&gt;
jshell 11&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Additionally verified on Java 10 and Java 9.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Hopefully should not matter but worth noting:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#8756;locale&lt;br/&gt;
LANG=&quot;en_US.UTF-8&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
LC_COLLATE=&quot;en_US.UTF-8&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
LC_CTYPE=&quot;en_US.UTF-8&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
LC_MESSAGES=&quot;en_US.UTF-8&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
LC_MONETARY=&quot;en_US.UTF-8&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
LC_NUMERIC=&quot;en_US.UTF-8&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
LC_TIME=&quot;en_US.UTF-8&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
LC_ALL=&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="13188340">VALIDATOR-448</key>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-445] Inet6Address may also contain a scope id</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-445</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;InetAddressValidator.isValidInet6Address incorrectly returns false for IPv6 address that contains a scope id such as in this:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;fe80:0:0:0:c1e1:54cf:68bc:9d5e%12&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13179362">VALIDATOR-445</key>
            <summary>Inet6Address may also contain a scope id</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="devson">devson</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 16 Aug 2018 14:03:17 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sat, 8 Aug 2020 11:55:43 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 27 Jul 2020 13:48:38 +0000</resolved>
                                                    <fixVersion>1.7</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>

                            <comment id="16775929" author="up201809108" created="Sat, 23 Feb 2019 16:26:02 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hello devson, is it possible for me to contribute to this project, mainly this issue? thank you&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16775982" author="devson" created="Sat, 23 Feb 2019 18:30:43 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi Tiago,&lt;/p&gt;

                            <comment id="17165693" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Mon, 27 Jul 2020 13:15:35 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I can confirm that the current implementation does not support scope zones introduced by the &apos;%&apos; character.&lt;br/&gt;
Nor does it support the /dd bit prefix length specifier&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-444] LongValidator: numbers bigger than the maxvalue are Valid</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-444</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;If you try to validate&#160;a Value bigger than&#160;9,223,372,036,854,775,807 it keeps valid.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&#160;for example with:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
LongValidator longValidator = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; LongValidator ( &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt;, AbstractNumberValidator.STANDARD_FORMAT );
longValidator.isValid(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;9223372036854775808&quot;&lt;/span&gt;) &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// is &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;true&lt;/span&gt; should be &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;false&lt;/span&gt; max &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;long&lt;/span&gt; is 9223372036854775807&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;even worse is that:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
longValidator.validate ( &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;9999999999999999999999999999999999999&quot;&lt;/span&gt;)
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;will give you the long maxValue as Result.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The IntegerValidator will give you null and nonValid.&#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13177953">VALIDATOR-444</key>
            <summary>LongValidator: numbers bigger than the maxvalue are Valid</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="wurtzelsepp">Martin Scholz</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 9 Aug 2018 11:17:00 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sat, 8 Aug 2020 11:55:50 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Fri, 19 Jun 2020 15:57:04 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.6</version>
                                    <fixVersion>1.7</fixVersion>
                                    <component>Routines</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>

                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-442] EmailValidator and zero-width space</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-442</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;EmailValidator does not take into account category &quot;Cf&quot; in the Unicode specification.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;String test = &quot;test@email.com*\u200b*&quot;; //Unicode&#160;zero-width space&lt;br/&gt;
 boolean valid = EmailValidator.getInstance().isValid(test);&lt;br/&gt;
 System.out.println(&quot;Is valid: &quot;+valid);&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;//Returns true&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13173391">VALIDATOR-442</key>
            <summary>EmailValidator and zero-width space</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/open.png" description="The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.">Open</status>
                    <statusCategory id="2" key="new" colorName="blue-gray"/>
                                    <resolution id="-1">Unresolved</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="alexcat">Alessandro Cataldo</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Fri, 20 Jul 2018 08:08:36 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sun, 26 Jul 2020 23:05:44 +0000</updated>
                                            <version>1.6</version>
                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="17165359" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Sun, 26 Jul 2020 23:05:44 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This is caused by DomainValidator, which ignores zero-width space.&lt;br/&gt;
The code uses java.net.IDN.toASCII which drops such characters, following the rules in rfc3454.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It&apos;s not clear to me that zero-width space should be disallowed.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>
                    </attachments>
                <subtasks>
                    </subtasks>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-439] bad&#163;$Email@Something.com is accepted</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-439</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;By chance we chose the string &quot;bad&#163;$Email@Something.com&quot; as a test string, but it passes validation?!&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;e.g.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;import&lt;/span&gt; org.apache.commons.validator.routines.EmailValidator;

&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;class &lt;/span&gt;TryEmailValidator
{
   &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;static&lt;/span&gt; void main(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;[] args)
   {
      &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (EmailValidator.getInstance().isValid(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;bad&#163;$Email@Something.com&quot;&lt;/span&gt;))
      {
         &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;throw&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; RuntimeException(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;That&apos;s not right?!&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
      }
   }
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13158249">VALIDATOR-439</key>
            <summary>bad&#163;$Email@Something.com is accepted</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-438] IBANValidator fails for El Salvador</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-438</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The &lt;tt&gt;IBANValidator&lt;/tt&gt; does not validate the IBANs from El Salvador, even though they are part of the IBAN registry.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;E.g. &lt;tt&gt;SV62CENR00000000000000700025&lt;/tt&gt; fails but should pass.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;See &lt;a href=&quot;https://www.iban.com/structure.html&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://www.iban.com/structure.html&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13153332">VALIDATOR-438</key>
            <summary>IBANValidator fails for El Salvador</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>

Unfortunately SWIFT don&apos;t include a proper change list in new versions of the document so manual checking is needed.&lt;/p&gt;

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-436] apache common validation is displaying only passed args like {0} in spring 3.2.0</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-436</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;My project previously deployed on Websphere7 with spring 1.2 and apache common validator 1.1.4. The validation was working fine.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Now as per the requirement change we have migrated the project to JBOSS eap 6.4 with spring 3.2.0 and apache common validator 1.1.4. Now the validation is not working as expected.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Issue: &lt;br/&gt;
we have employer group id field with required validation. when we try submitting the form without entering the value for the field it should show &quot;Please enter value for Employer Group ID&quot;. But it&apos;s displaying only &quot;Employer Group ID&quot;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Please find below code:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Jsp page:&lt;br/&gt;
----------&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;lt;%@ taglib prefix=&quot;core&quot; uri=&quot;http://java.sun.com/jstl/core&quot; %&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
 &amp;lt;%@ taglib prefix=&quot;fmt&quot; uri=&quot;http://java.sun.com/jstl/fmt&quot; %&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
 &amp;lt;%@ taglib prefix=&quot;str&quot; uri=&quot;http://jakarta.apache.org/taglibs/string-1.0.1&quot; &lt;br/&gt;
 %&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
 &amp;lt;%@ taglib prefix=&quot;spring&quot; uri=&quot;http://www.springframework.org/tags&quot; %&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt; &amp;lt;%@ taglib uri=&quot;http://jakarta.apache.org/taglibs/i18n-1.0&quot; prefix=&quot;i18n&quot; %&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
 &amp;lt;i18n:bundle baseName=&quot;jspresources.xxx-label&quot; localeRef=&quot;userLocale&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt; &amp;lt;tr&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
 &amp;lt;spring:bind path=&quot;createForm.empNumber&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
 &amp;lt;td class=&quot;message&quot; align=&quot;left&quot; colspan=&quot;2&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
 &amp;lt;strong&amp;gt;&amp;lt;core:out value=&quot;${status.errorMessage}&quot; /&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/strong&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/td&amp;gt; &lt;br/&gt;
 &amp;lt;/spring:bind&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
 &amp;lt;/tr&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;Validation.xml:&lt;br/&gt;
--------------&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt; &amp;lt;form name=&quot;createForm&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
 &amp;lt;field property=&quot;empNumber&quot; &lt;br/&gt;
 depends=&quot;mask,alphaNumeric,required,minlength,maxlength&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
 &amp;lt;arg0 key=&quot;createForm.empNumber&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
 &amp;lt;msg name=&quot;required&quot; key=&quot;errors.required&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
 &amp;lt;arg1 name=&quot;minlength&quot; key=&quot;${var:minlength}&quot; resource=&quot;false&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
 &amp;lt;arg1 name=&quot;maxlength&quot; key=&quot;${var:maxlength}&quot; resource=&quot;false&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
 &amp;lt;msg name=&quot;alphaNumeric&quot; key=&quot;errors.alphanum&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
 &amp;lt;msg name=&quot;mask&quot; key=&quot;errors.invalid&quot;/&amp;gt; &lt;br/&gt;
 &amp;lt;var&amp;gt;&amp;lt;var-name&amp;gt;mask&amp;lt;/var-name&amp;gt;&amp;lt;var-value&amp;gt;^&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;^(0|\ )+&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;a-zA-Z0-9&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;*$&amp;lt;/var-&lt;br/&gt;
 value&amp;gt;&amp;lt;/var&amp;gt; &lt;br/&gt;
 &amp;lt;var&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
 &amp;lt;var-name&amp;gt;minlength&amp;lt;/var-name&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
 &amp;lt;var-value&amp;gt;1&amp;lt;/var-value&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
 &amp;lt;/var&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
 &amp;lt;var&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
 &amp;lt;var-name&amp;gt;maxlength&amp;lt;/var-name&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
 &amp;lt;var-value&amp;gt;9&amp;lt;/var-value&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
 &amp;lt;/var&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
 &amp;lt;/field&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
 &amp;lt;/form&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;validator-rules.xml:&lt;br/&gt;
---------------------&lt;br/&gt;
 &amp;lt;validator name=&quot;required&quot; classname=&quot;PropertyChecks&quot; &lt;br/&gt;
 method=&quot;validateRequired&quot; methodParams=&quot;java.lang.Object, &lt;br/&gt;
 org.apache.commons.validator.ValidatorAction,org.apache.commons.&lt;br/&gt;
 validator.Field, &lt;br/&gt;
 org.springframework.validation.Errors,org.apache.commons.validator.&lt;br/&gt;
 Validator&quot; msg=&quot;errors.required&quot;/&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;ApplicationResources.properties:&lt;br/&gt;
---------------------------------&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt; createForm.empNumber=Employer Group Id&lt;br/&gt;
 errors.required=Please enter {0}.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;applicationContext.xml:&lt;br/&gt;
-----------------------&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt; &amp;lt;beans&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt; &amp;lt;bean id=&quot;messageSource&quot; &lt;br/&gt;
 class=&quot;org.springframework.context.support.ResourceBundleMessageSource&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
 &amp;lt;property name=&quot;basename&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
 &amp;lt;value&amp;gt;messages&amp;lt;/value&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
 &amp;lt;/property&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
 &amp;lt;/bean&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
 &amp;lt;bean id=&quot;validatorUtil&quot;&lt;br/&gt;
 class=&quot;UtilFormValidator&quot; init-method=&quot;init&quot; singleton=&quot;true&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
 &amp;lt;property name=&quot;resources&quot;&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
 &amp;lt;list&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
 &amp;lt;value&amp;gt;validator-rules.xml&amp;lt;/value&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
 &amp;lt;value&amp;gt;validation.xml&amp;lt;/value&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-434] Field does not synchronize iteration on synchronized list</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-434</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Place holder for &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-validator/pull/4&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-validator/pull/4&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Basically, we create a synchronized list with Collections.synchronizedList. But we are not synchronizing when accessing the iterator. The API contains documentation that states that users must synchronize when iterating the list created with Collections.synchronizedList.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="13119397">VALIDATOR-434</key>
            <summary>Field does not synchronize iteration on synchronized list</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="kinow">Bruno P. Kinoshita</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="kinow">Bruno P. Kinoshita</reporter>
                        <labels>
                            <label>thread-safety</label>
                    </labels>
                <created>Sat, 18 Nov 2017 03:29:13 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sat, 8 Aug 2020 11:55:44 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Tue, 21 Nov 2017 09:51:46 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.6</version>
                                    <fixVersion>1.7</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-433] BigDecimalValidator does not validate &quot;()&quot; negative currency uniformly for all locales</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-433</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Hi, &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The following tests fail: &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;final String JAPAN_YEN = (new DecimalFormatSymbols(Locale.JAPAN)).getCurrencySymbol(); &lt;br/&gt;
final String CHINA_YEN = (new DecimalFormatSymbols(Locale.CHINA)).getCurrencySymbol(); &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;BigDecimal negative = new BigDecimal(&quot;-1234.56&quot;); &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;assertEquals(&quot;Japan negative&quot;, negative, validator.validate(&quot;(&quot; + JAPAN_YEN + &quot;1,234.56)&quot;, Locale.CHINA)); &lt;br/&gt;
assertEquals(&quot;China negative&quot;, negative, validator.validate(&quot;(&quot; + CHINA_YEN + &quot;1,234.56)&quot;, Locale.CHINA)); &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Please not that this test do not fail for other locales (US AND UK, for example). &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Please advise on whether this is an issue, if there is a workaround, etc... &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Regards, &lt;br/&gt;
John DiPirro&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Windows 10, Tomcat 6, Java 8&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="13119229">VALIDATOR-433</key>
            <summary>BigDecimalValidator does not validate &quot;()&quot; negative currency uniformly for all locales</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="2" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/critical.svg">Critical</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="10004">Not A Bug</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="kinow">Bruno P. Kinoshita</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="jjdipirro">John DiPirro</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Fri, 17 Nov 2017 13:51:57 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 30 Nov 2017 21:07:58 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Tue, 21 Nov 2017 08:09:36 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.6</version>
                                                    <component>Routines</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="16257900" author="kinow" created="Sat, 18 Nov 2017 03:15:34 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Can you share a complete test case for that? The following code fails with US too, but not sure if you have similar code.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
    @Test
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;public&lt;/span&gt; void bigDecimalValidatorTest() {
        BigDecimalValidator validator = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; BigDecimalValidator();
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; US_DOLLAR = (&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; DecimalFormatSymbols(Locale.US)).getCurrencySymbol();
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; JAPAN_YEN = (&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; DecimalFormatSymbols(Locale.JAPAN)).getCurrencySymbol();
        &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;final&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; CHINA_YEN = (&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; DecimalFormatSymbols(Locale.CHINA)).getCurrencySymbol();

        BigDecimal negative = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; BigDecimal(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;-1234.56&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);

        assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;US negative&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, negative, validator.validate(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;(&quot;&lt;/span&gt; + US_DOLLAR + &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;1,234.56)&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, Locale.US)); &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// fails
&lt;/span&gt;        assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Japan negative&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, negative, validator.validate(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;(&quot;&lt;/span&gt; + JAPAN_YEN + &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;1,234.56)&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, Locale.CHINA)); &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// fails
&lt;/span&gt;        assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;China negative&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, negative, validator.validate(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;(&quot;&lt;/span&gt; + CHINA_YEN + &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;1,234.56)&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, Locale.CHINA)); &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// fails
&lt;/span&gt;    }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16258081" author="jjdipirro" created="Sat, 18 Nov 2017 13:59:57 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Attaching test file:  &lt;span class=&quot;nobr&quot;&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12898339/12898339_CurrencyValidatorTest.java&quot; title=&quot;CurrencyValidatorTest.java attached to VALIDATOR-433&quot;&gt;CurrencyValidatorTest.java&lt;sup&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;rendericon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/link_attachment_7.gif&quot; height=&quot;7&quot; width=&quot;7&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;and image from Eclipse:  &lt;span class=&quot;nobr&quot;&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12898338/12898338_junitResults.jpg&quot; title=&quot;junitResults.jpg attached to VALIDATOR-433&quot;&gt;junitResults.jpg&lt;sup&gt;&lt;img class=&quot;rendericon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/link_attachment_7.gif&quot; height=&quot;7&quot; width=&quot;7&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/span&gt;  showing the test result (failure on UK).   &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Overall, US passes, UK/China/Japan fail.  I had thought UK passed in a previous test.  Please advise.&lt;/p&gt;

</comment>
                            <comment id="16260402" author="kinow" created="Tue, 21 Nov 2017 08:12:22 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Hi John, thanks for the test case, that helped.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;There are different negative prefixes and negative suffixes, depending on the locale you use. This is controlled by the JVM, not by Commons Validator, so not much can be done here.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The UK locale expects you to use &quot;-&#163;1,234.56&quot;. Here&apos;s a code that generates the list of locales and their prefix/suffix pairs.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
Locale[] locales = Locale.getAvailableLocales();
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;for&lt;/span&gt; (Locale locale : locales) {
    DecimalFormat nf = (DecimalFormat) NumberFormat.getCurrencyInstance(locale);
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; negativePrefix = nf.getNegativePrefix();
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; negativeSuffix = nf.getNegativeSuffix();
    &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;System&lt;/span&gt;.out.println(&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;.format(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;%s---%s\t%s&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, negativePrefix, negativeSuffix, locale.getDisplayName()));
}
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16260414" author="kinow" created="Tue, 21 Nov 2017 08:24:38 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Here&apos;s the output:&lt;/p&gt;

(RD$---)	Spanish (Dominican Republic)
(CU$---)	Spanish (Cuba)
&#164; ----	Arabic
-&#164; ---	Russian
-$---	English (New Zealand)
-&#1076;&#1080;&#1085;. ---	Serbian (Serbia)
SFr.----	German (Switzerland)
(NU$---)	Spanish (Uruguay)
-&#164; ---	Malay
---- &#8364;	Greek (Greece)
---- &#1513;&quot;&#1495;	Hebrew (Israel)
R----	English (South Africa)
&#3647;----	Thai (Thailand,TH)
-&#164; ---	Hindi
---- &#8364;	French (France)
-&#8364; ---	German (Austria)
-&#164; ---	Dutch
kr ----	Norwegian (Norway)
-$---	English (Australia)
-&#164; ---	Vietnamese
&#8364; ----	Dutch (Netherlands)
(---$)	French (Canada)
---- &#8364;	Latvian (Latvia)
---- &#8364;	German (Luxembourg)
(C---)	Spanish (Costa Rica)
&#1583;.&#1603;.&#8207; ----	Arabic (Kuwait)
-&#164; ---	Serbian
&#1583;.&#1604;.&#8207; ----	Arabic (Libya)
-&#164; ---	Maltese
SFr.----	Italian (Switzerland)
-&#164; ---	Danish
---- &#8364;	German (Germany)
&#1583;.&#1580;.&#8207; ----	Arabic (Algeria)
---- &#8364;	Slovak (Slovakia)
---- &#8364;	Lithuanian (Lithuania)
-&#8364; ---	Italian (Italy)
-&#8364;---	English (Ireland)
-S$---	Chinese (Singapore)
-&#164; ---	Romanian
-$---	English (Canada)
---- &#8364;	Dutch (Belgium)

-&#65509;---	Chinese (China)
-&#65509;---	Japanese (Japan)

-Den ---	Macedonian (Macedonia)

&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16260427" author="kinow" created="Tue, 21 Nov 2017 08:36:10 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;So, accordingly, your test would have to be:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;
assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;US negative&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, negative, validator.validate(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;(&quot;&lt;/span&gt; + US_DOLLAR + &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;1,234.56)&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, Locale.US));
assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;UK negative&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, negative, validator.validate(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;-&quot;&lt;/span&gt; + UK_POUND + &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;1,234.56&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, Locale.UK));
assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;China negative&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, negative, validator.validate(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;-&quot;&lt;/span&gt; + CHINA_RMB + &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;1,234.56&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, Locale.CHINA));
assertEquals(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Japan negative&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, negative2, validator.validate(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;-&quot;&lt;/span&gt; + JAPAN_YEN + &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;1,234&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, Locale.JAPAN));
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;To pass, and it would be following what the Locale defines as the negative prefix and the negative suffix. You can either change the logic of your application to take into consideration how local handles these prefix/suffix pairs, or try using a more generic like &#164;#,###.##;-&#164;#,###.##.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Hope that helps,&lt;br/&gt;
Bruno&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="16273428" author="jjdipirro" created="Thu, 30 Nov 2017 21:07:58 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Issue addressed, custom formatting solution will be needed to compensate for non-uniformity of how JVM interprets &quot;()&apos; negative prefix/suffix.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
