<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-391] UrlValidator.isValid throws exception for FILEURLs</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-391</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;In UrlValidator.java from v1.5.0, there is the following section which generates a null pointer exception, rendering isValid unusable for FILE URLs.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeHeader panelHeader&quot; style=&quot;border-bottom-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;b&gt;org/apache/commons/validator/routines/UrlValidator.java&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;file&quot;&lt;/span&gt;.equals(scheme)) {&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// Special &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;case&lt;/span&gt; - file: allows an empty authority
&lt;/span&gt;            &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (!&quot;&quot;.equals(authority)) {
                &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;if&lt;/span&gt; (authority.contains(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;:&quot;&lt;/span&gt;)) { &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// but cannot allow trailing :
&lt;/span&gt;                    &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;return&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;false&lt;/span&gt;;
                }
            }
            &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// drop through to &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;continue&lt;/span&gt; validation
&lt;/span&gt;        }
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;In the case of a file URL given in my example below, authority is null, and thusly doesn&apos;t equal a blank string, so it drops down and calls authority.contains, which generates a NullPointerException.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeHeader panelHeader&quot; style=&quot;border-bottom-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;b&gt;Example to generate exception&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;File localFile = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; File(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;c:\\path\\to\\dir\\&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
URL localURL = localFile.toURI().toURL();
&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; urlString = localURL.toString(); &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;file:/C:/path/to/dir/&quot;&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;[] schemes = {&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;file&quot;&lt;/span&gt;};
UrlValidator urlValidator = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; UrlValidator(schemes);

urlValidator.isValid(urlString); &lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;// &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt; pointer exception&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12944598">VALIDATOR-391</key>
            <summary>UrlValidator.isValid throws exception for FILEURLs</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="mark_scott_jr">Mark E. Scott, Jr.</reporter>
                        <labels>
                            <label>easyfix</label>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 25 Feb 2016 19:01:03 +0000</created>
                <updated>Wed, 22 Feb 2017 16:36:26 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 2 May 2016 16:51:27 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.5.0</version>
                                    <fixVersion>1.6</fixVersion>
                                    <component>Routines</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>1</votes>
                                    <watches>3</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15263638" author="loomisja" created="Fri, 29 Apr 2016 06:56:12 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The attached patch resolves the NullPointerException in isValid() for file URLs by verifying that &apos;authority&apos; is not null prior to attempting to access any members of the object. Also modified the check for &quot;non-empty&quot; string to match a similar check performed in isValidAuthority().&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Note: the URL in the example provided:&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;a href=&quot;file:/C:/path/to/dir/&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;file:/C:/path/to/dir/&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
is not valid; the authority is missing entirely; a valid URL for this directory would be:&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;a href=&quot;file:///C:/path/to/dir/&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;file:///C:/path/to/dir/&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
However, the URLValidator should be able to handle either case.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This patch fixes a major bug with a very minor change.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15263681" author="loomisja" created="Fri, 29 Apr 2016 07:31:16 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Attached simple test for NullPointerException with the example URL:&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;a href=&quot;file:/C:/path/to/dir/&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;file:/C:/path/to/dir/&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15266959" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Mon, 2 May 2016 16:51:28 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks for the report and patches.&lt;br/&gt;
Fixed with some minor changes as below:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;URL: &lt;a href=&quot;http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?rev=1742006&amp;amp;view=rev&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?rev=1742006&amp;amp;view=rev&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Log:&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-391&quot; title=&quot;UrlValidator.isValid throws exception for FILEURLs&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;VALIDATOR-391&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;VALIDATOR-391&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; UrlValidator.isValid throws exception for FILEURLs&lt;br/&gt;
    Fixed code so it handles URLs with no authority field&lt;/p&gt;

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-389] DomainValidator static public updateTLDOverride method contains non-public input parameter data type</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-389</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;In the DomainValidator class there is a new public static method updateTLDOverride that allows the TLD list to be updated dynamically. However the input parameter &lt;b&gt;org.apache.commons.validator.routines.DomainValidator.ArrayType&lt;/b&gt; is a non-public enum defined in the DomainValidator class and cannot be referenced in a static public context. Therefore this method is unusable unless the DomainValidator class is extended, which I don&apos;t think was the original intention of this new static method.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12935700">VALIDATOR-389</key>
            <summary>DomainValidator static public updateTLDOverride method contains non-public input parameter data type</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="3">Duplicate</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="cdavies">Charles Davies</reporter>
                        <labels>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-388] Email Validator accepts invalid E-Mail Address</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-388</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;According to wikipedia &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;1&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;, the e-mail address&lt;br/&gt;
```&lt;br/&gt;
this\ still\&quot;not&lt;br class=&quot;atl-forced-newline&quot; /&gt;allowed@example.com&lt;br/&gt;
```&lt;br/&gt;
is invalid. However, the EmailValidator class accepts this as valid.&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;1. &lt;a href=&quot;https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Email_address#Syntax&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Email_address#Syntax&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12935035">VALIDATOR-388</key>
            <summary>Email Validator accepts invalid E-Mail Address</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="6">Invalid</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="rethab.ch">Reto Habluetzel</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Fri, 29 Jan 2016 07:27:04 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sun, 5 Feb 2017 18:22:58 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Sun, 5 Feb 2017 18:22:58 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.5.0</version>
                                                    <component>Routines</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15123137" author="rethab.ch" created="Fri, 29 Jan 2016 07:29:46 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;extended EmailValidatorTest with this case&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15853304" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Sun, 5 Feb 2017 18:22:58 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I disagree; in this case I think Wikipedia is wrong.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;RFC 3696  says (page 5):&lt;br/&gt;
The exact rule is that any ASCII character, including control characters, may appear quoted, or in a quoted string.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-387] Userinfo without colon should be valid in UrlValidator</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-387</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;UrlValidator does not accept userinfo without &quot;:&quot;.&lt;br/&gt;
The following code returns false.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;UrlValidator validator = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; UrlValidator();
validator.isValid(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;http:&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;//user@www.apache.org:80/path&quot;&lt;/span&gt;)&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;But it should be accepted.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;RFC of URI allows userinfo without colon.&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;a href=&quot;https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986#section-3.2.1&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986#section-3.2.1&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;blockquote&gt;
&lt;p&gt;userinfo    = *( unreserved / pct-encoded / sub-delims / &quot;:&quot; )&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;

&lt;p&gt;RFC of URL also allows it.&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;a href=&quot;https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1738#section-3.1&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1738#section-3.1&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;blockquote&gt;
&lt;p&gt; //&amp;lt;user&amp;gt;:&amp;lt;password&amp;gt;@&amp;lt;host&amp;gt;:&amp;lt;port&amp;gt;/&amp;lt;url-path&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
   Some or all of the parts &quot;&amp;lt;user&amp;gt;:&amp;lt;password&amp;gt;@&quot;, &quot;:&amp;lt;password&amp;gt;&quot;,&lt;br/&gt;
   &quot;:&amp;lt;port&amp;gt;&quot;, and &quot;/&amp;lt;url-path&amp;gt;&quot; may be excluded. &lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I created Pull Request.&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/apache/commons-validator/pull/5&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://github.com/apache/commons-validator/pull/5&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12934707">VALIDATOR-387</key>
            <summary>Userinfo without colon should be valid in UrlValidator</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="shumpei-akai">Shumpei Akai</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 28 Jan 2016 06:59:44 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sun, 4 Feb 2018 13:46:17 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Sun, 5 Feb 2017 18:35:48 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.5.0</version>
                                    <fixVersion>1.6</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>

                                    <watches>2</watches>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-386] org.apache.commons.validator.routines.DomainValidator.ArrayType is not public</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-386</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Version 1.5.0 adds the possibility to override TLDs using: &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;tt&gt;org.apache.commons.validator.routines.DomainValidator#updateTLDOverride&lt;/tt&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;however the first parameter to that function is package scoped. This seems like a bug to me, to implement an override I have to create a class in &lt;tt&gt;org.apache.commons.validator.routines&lt;/tt&gt; for me to use this functionality.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12926901">VALIDATOR-386</key>
            <summary>org.apache.commons.validator.routines.DomainValidator.ArrayType is not public</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="aukevanleeuwen">Auke van Leeuwen</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Mon, 4 Jan 2016 08:08:38 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sun, 1 May 2016 21:38:38 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Thu, 7 Jan 2016 05:30:17 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.5.0</version>
                                    <fixVersion>1.5.1</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15086799" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Thu, 7 Jan 2016 04:53:16 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Agreed, the scope is wrong.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;Needs a unit test in a different package to show this&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-385] Flag in getInstance for tld has no influence on actual behavior</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-385</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Hello, &lt;br/&gt;
I recently stumbled over an error validating an email in our system.&lt;br/&gt;
A client could not register, although his tld was recently added to the valid ones. After updating to the newest version of commons-validator the whitelist was updated and the problem gone, but I still wondered why the tld was even checked in the first place. The flag for that was set to false.&lt;br/&gt;
I checked the EmailValidator and DomainValidator code and came to the conclusion, that the parameter allowTld (in getInstance) has no influence on the fact if tld&apos;s are checked, they seem to be checked in any case in the DomainValidator isValid() -&amp;gt; isValidTld method.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12924182">VALIDATOR-385</key>
            <summary>Flag in getInstance for tld has no influence on actual behavior</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="8">Not A Problem</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="yannick">Yannick Gladow</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 24 Dec 2015 11:14:56 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 28 Dec 2015 13:59:45 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 28 Dec 2015 13:59:45 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.5.0</version>
                    <version>1.5.1</version>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-384] EmailValidator does not support escaped quotes in a quoted string</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-384</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;EmailValidator does not support escaped quotes &apos;\&quot;&apos; within a quoted string as specified by &lt;a href=&quot;https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5322#page-13&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;RFC5322 section 3.2.4&lt;/a&gt; as well as in the older &lt;a href=&quot;https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2822#page-13&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;RFC2822 section 3.2.5&lt;/a&gt;.  &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;These sections indicate that a quoted string can contain a quoted pair (escaped characters), where a quoted pair is defined as (in RFC5322):&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;blockquote&gt;
&lt;p&gt;   quoted-pair     =   (&quot;\&quot; (VCHAR / WSP)) / obs-qp&lt;br/&gt;
   VCHAR = %x21-7E; visible (printing) characters&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The &quot; character is %x22 which falls under the definition of VCHAR above.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Examples: &lt;/p&gt;
&lt;blockquote&gt;
&lt;p&gt;  &quot;example\&quot;email&quot;@example.org&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;
</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12920098">VALIDATOR-384</key>
            <summary>EmailValidator does not support escaped quotes in a quoted string</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="babster">Kris Babic</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 8 Dec 2015 14:54:21 +0000</created>
                <updated>Sun, 1 May 2016 21:38:37 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Thu, 7 Jan 2016 15:22:02 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.5.0</version>
                                    <fixVersion>1.5.1</fixVersion>
                                    <component>Routines</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15046935" author="babster" created="Tue, 8 Dec 2015 14:56:18 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Patch which updates the QUOTED_USER regular expression to allow for an escaped quote  &apos;\&quot;&apos; to be contained within the quoted string component of the local address.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15087517" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Thu, 7 Jan 2016 14:48:10 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thanks for the patch.&lt;br/&gt;
However it appears to allow any character after the escape, rather than just double-quote.&lt;br/&gt;
I wonder why that was done?&lt;br/&gt;
The original RE only disallowed &quot; within the quoted string, so it should only be necessary to allow an escaped quote.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15087567" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Thu, 7 Jan 2016 15:22:02 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Fixed with allowing just \&quot;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;URL: &lt;a href=&quot;http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?rev=1723573&amp;amp;view=rev&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?rev=1723573&amp;amp;view=rev&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
Log:&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-384&quot; title=&quot;EmailValidator does not support escaped quotes in a quoted string&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;VALIDATOR-384&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;VALIDATOR-384&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; EmailValidator does not support escaped quotes in a quoted string&lt;/p&gt;

    commons/proper/validator/trunk/src/changes/changes.xml&lt;br/&gt;

    commons/proper/validator/trunk/src/test/java/org/apache/commons/validator/routines/EmailValidatorTest.java&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-383] Commons-collections object deserialization remote command execution vulnerability</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-383</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;I copied this issue from a different project since it also impacts commons-validator.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Read: &lt;a href=&quot;http://foxglovesecurity.com/2015/11/06/what-do-weblogic-websphere-jboss-jenkins-opennms-and-your-application-have-in-common-this-vulnerability/&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://foxglovesecurity.com/2015/11/06/what-do-weblogic-websphere-jboss-jenkins-opennms-and-your-application-have-in-common-this-vulnerability/&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;
TL;DR: If you have commons-collections on your classpath and accept and process Java object serialization data, then you probably have an exploitable remote command execution vulnerability.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The Commons Collection dependency should be upgraded to the latest version (4.1) to remediate this vulnerability.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12918171">VALIDATOR-383</key>
            <summary>Commons-collections object deserialization remote command execution vulnerability</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="8">Not A Problem</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="bkite92">Brandon Kite</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 3 Dec 2015 23:35:56 +0000</created>
                <updated>Fri, 4 Dec 2015 01:41:05 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Fri, 4 Dec 2015 01:41:05 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.4.1 Release</version>
                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="15039558" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Fri, 4 Dec 2015 01:41:05 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;1) Validator only uses FastHashMap which AFAICT is unrelated.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;2) in any case, Collections is not vulnerable unless the deserialisation code is passed unsanitised input; i.e. it is an application issue, not a library issue.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-382] URL validator returns false to FTP url with username and password</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-382</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The following ftp address is a valid ftp url, but the url validator returns false.&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;a href=&quot;ftp://username:password@example.com:8042/over/there/index.dtb?type=animal&amp;amp;name=narwhal#nose&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;ftp://username:password@example.com:8042/over/there/index.dtb?type=animal&amp;amp;name=narwhal#nose&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-380] UrlValidator does not allow for optional port digits</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-380</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;According to RFC 3986, the port number is defined as:&lt;br/&gt;
port    = *DIGIT&lt;br/&gt;
This means 0 or more digits.&lt;br/&gt;
If it required at least one digit then it would be:&lt;br/&gt;
port    =  1*DIGIT&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;However the code requires at least one digit.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12911602">VALIDATOR-380</key>
            <summary>UrlValidator does not allow for optional port digits</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="4" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/minor.svg">Minor</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-379] CodeValidator unconditionally trim()s the input string</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-379</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The CodeValidator class unconditionally calls String#trim() on the input.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This seems wrong.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If the calling code uses the return value from validate to pass to other methods that would be OK, but not all code will do so, especially since this is not documented.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Code that calls isValid() instead is likely to pass the untrimmed code to a method which is not expecting the additional spaces.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It&apos;s also possible (but rather unlikely) that there are formats which require leading or trailing spaces.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;At the very least this behaviour needs to be documented.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;There probably ought to be a non-trimming version.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Note that this affects the CreditCardValidator and the ISBNValidator.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12911395">VALIDATOR-379</key>
            <summary>CodeValidator unconditionally trim()s the input string</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="sebb">Sebb</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Mon, 9 Nov 2015 01:04:02 +0000</created>
                <updated>Wed, 22 Feb 2017 16:36:27 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Sun, 5 Feb 2017 18:47:22 +0000</resolved>
                                                    <fixVersion>1.6</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="14996398" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Mon, 9 Nov 2015 11:39:57 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;CodeValidator may also use RegexValidator to reformat the input.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So perhaps the problem is really that the isValid() method is misleading.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="15853312" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Sun, 5 Feb 2017 18:47:22 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Document the behaviour:&lt;/p&gt;

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-378] IBAN bank identifier with missing leading 0 </title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-378</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The validator accepts as valid an IBAN with a missing zero in the bank identifier. For example: &lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;CH59 9000 0001 7342 7712 : is valid (should not be)&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;li&gt;CH59 09000 0001 7342 7712 : is valid&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12910383">VALIDATOR-378</key>
            <summary>IBAN bank identifier with missing leading 0 </summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="8">Not A Problem</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="obennour">Bennour</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Wed, 4 Nov 2015 16:09:26 +0000</created>
                <updated>Thu, 5 Nov 2015 01:21:16 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Thu, 5 Nov 2015 01:21:16 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.4.1 Release</version>
                                                    <component>Routines</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>1</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="14990303" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Wed, 4 Nov 2015 20:08:53 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;As per the Javadoc &lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;1&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt;:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&quot; Note: the class does not check the format of the IBAN number, only the check digits.&quot;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The missing leading zero does not affect the check-digit calculation.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;If I remember correctly, the length of the IBAN varies between countries, and may potentially change.&lt;br/&gt;
I&apos;m not sure it is feasible to implement further validation.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;1&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; &lt;a href=&quot;http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-validator/javadocs/api-1.4.1/org/apache/commons/validator/routines/checkdigit/IBANCheckDigit.html&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-validator/javadocs/api-1.4.1/org/apache/commons/validator/routines/checkdigit/IBANCheckDigit.html&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14990888" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Thu, 5 Nov 2015 01:21:16 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;IBANCheckDigit is only for validating the check digit, not the format.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;See the linked issue for a possible solution using a separate class.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-376] EmailValidator says addresses such as x.y@gmail are valid although most mail apps will fail to send it</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-376</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;The &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-273&quot; title=&quot;EmailValidator does not support mailboxes at TLDs&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;VALIDATOR-273&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;VALIDATOR-273&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; patch causes EmailValidator to allow addresses such as x.y@gmail. Unfortunately, this is causing us problems as none of the email apps we have tried will actually allow that email address to be sent. Although the RFCs may state it is valid, in practice it apparently isn&apos;t. Some sort of option is needed to allow providing just the domain to fail. As a consequence we have had to revert to a prior release of commons-validator.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12901201">VALIDATOR-376</key>
            <summary>EmailValidator says addresses such as x.y@gmail are valid although most mail apps will fail to send it</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="rgoers">Ralph Goers</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Tue, 29 Sep 2015 00:46:23 +0000</created>
                <updated>Tue, 26 Jul 2016 09:32:23 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Sun, 25 Oct 2015 06:05:01 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.4.1 Release</version>
                                    <fixVersion>1.5.0</fixVersion>
                                    <component>Routines</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>4</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="14934457" author="b.eckenfels" created="Tue, 29 Sep 2015 01:22:01 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I guess there are two options. When doing a  purely lexicographic validity check of email addresses the Validator needs a list of valid TLDs and a mechanism to update them. (either all TLDs or specifically the dotlessones: &lt;a href=&quot;https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7085#section-2.3&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7085#section-2.3&lt;/a&gt;)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;When doing network based validation it needs a way to deal with 127.0.53.53 (and similiar?) blacklist answers. In case of @gmail. the MX records are caused by  &lt;a href=&quot;https://icann.org/namecollision&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;https://icann.org/namecollision&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14936432" author="ralph.goers@dslextreme.com" created="Wed, 30 Sep 2015 06:30:14 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;So how could this be accomplished?  I&apos;m happy to write the code if I have some idea as to what the recommended way to fix this might be.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14936447" author="b.eckenfels" created="Wed, 30 Sep 2015 06:51:05 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Ralph, in Validator itself I see 3 possibilities:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;A) revert &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-273&quot; title=&quot;EmailValidator does not support mailboxes at TLDs&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;VALIDATOR-273&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;VALIDATOR-273&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; or make it configurable if you want to accept dotless hosts. There are some valid but most wont encounter them in the wild&lt;br/&gt;
B) have a list of well known dotless hosts (see RFC above), the list needs to be maintained but missing entries are even less likely than A) to be encountered&lt;br/&gt;
C) have a list of all well known TLDs and verify email address against it. That list is more dynamic than B and not all TLDs are also dotless hosts, but its an additional check also usefull for the non-dotless case&lt;br/&gt;
D) accept that a purely syntax based check will not recognize all invalid addresses, a user entering x@gmail or x@aaaaaaaaaxxxx.com both could fool any more sophisticated whitelists. In your software looking up the address in DNS is a first step (and rejecting any unknown name or name which responds with 127.x.x.x). (Sending challenge mails is the second)&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Maybe implement b+c+d where b ships a default list and b+c allow a setter to load/refresh the lists. Applications can then chose to reload them or simply ship a resource.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14936448" author="jochen@apache.org" created="Wed, 30 Sep 2015 06:52:44 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Gut reaction (and without validating feasability):&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Optionally perform a DNS lookup for MX records. Below you find an example, how a DNS lookup from the command line reveals a meaningful reply in the case of &quot;gmail.com&quot;, but not in the case of &quot;gmail&quot;.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Important part: Make this optional. There are a multitude of scenarios, where DNS lookups will not be possible.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;-bash-3.2$ nslookup -type=mx gmail&lt;br/&gt;
Server:         85.214.7.22&lt;br/&gt;
Address:        85.214.7.22#53&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Non-authoritative answer:&lt;br/&gt;
gmail   mail exchanger = 10 your-dns-needs-immediate-attention.gmail.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Authoritative answers can be found from:&lt;br/&gt;
your-dns-needs-immediate-attention.gmail        internet address = 127.0.53.53&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;-bash-3.2$ nslookup -type=mx gmail.com&lt;br/&gt;
Server:         85.214.7.22&lt;br/&gt;
Address:        85.214.7.22#53&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Non-authoritative answer:&lt;br/&gt;
gmail.com       mail exchanger = 40 alt4.gmail-smtp-in.l.google.com.&lt;br/&gt;
gmail.com       mail exchanger = 10 alt1.gmail-smtp-in.l.google.com.&lt;br/&gt;
gmail.com       mail exchanger = 20 alt2.gmail-smtp-in.l.google.com.&lt;br/&gt;
gmail.com       mail exchanger = 30 alt3.gmail-smtp-in.l.google.com.&lt;br/&gt;
gmail.com       mail exchanger = 5 gmail-smtp-in.l.google.com.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Authoritative answers can be found from:&lt;br/&gt;
alt3.gmail-smtp-in.l.google.com internet address = 173.194.72.27&lt;br/&gt;
alt1.gmail-smtp-in.l.google.com internet address = 74.125.68.26&lt;br/&gt;
alt2.gmail-smtp-in.l.google.com internet address = 74.125.23.26&lt;br/&gt;
alt4.gmail-smtp-in.l.google.com internet address = 74.125.25.26&lt;br/&gt;
gmail-smtp-in.l.google.com      internet address = 74.125.136.26&lt;/p&gt;
</comment>
                            <comment id="14936466" author="ralph.goers@dslextreme.com" created="Wed, 30 Sep 2015 07:02:54 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Jochen - Are you suggesting that the application verify the domain every time it has to deal with an email address? That seems like it could get pretty expensive to do. I would imagine it would more likely be handled by sending an email to the user to confirm their email address.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I thought the point of EmailValidator was to verify that the syntax of an email address was correct. The issue is that although the RFC might say that just the domain is allowed that all the SMTP servers I have tried will fail to even accept the message with an address like that. So in the real world the syntax is correct in only a few cases.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14936468" author="b.eckenfels" created="Wed, 30 Sep 2015 07:06:17 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Have to correct myself, EmailValidator is using DomainValidator and that one already checks for a hardcoded list of TLD and gmail is on it. It will be useable for emails in the future and the validator is allowed to accept it - it might even be used by millions .... so the case C) is there and the application should do D).&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I am not sure if it is a good idea to provide actual network accessing code, as you typically need retries, different policies and proxy support.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14936470" author="ralph.goers@dslextreme.com" created="Wed, 30 Sep 2015 07:07:29 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Obviously there is a reason that &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-273&quot; title=&quot;EmailValidator does not support mailboxes at TLDs&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;VALIDATOR-273&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;VALIDATOR-273&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; was requested to be implemented. What I would prefer is that the default behavior of the isValid(String email) method be reverted back to the behavior prior to &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-273&quot; title=&quot;EmailValidator does not support mailboxes at TLDs&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;VALIDATOR-273&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;VALIDATOR-273&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; so that applications can easily migrate to the latest version. I would then suggest that the getInstance() method accept an additional boolean to enable the behavior that is currently implemented.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14936479" author="jochen@apache.org" created="Wed, 30 Sep 2015 07:21:43 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Ralph: I am suggesting that we verify the domain &lt;b&gt;if the user requests it&lt;/b&gt;. That covers the &quot;expensive&quot; parts, IMO.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14936483" author="ralph.goers@dslextreme.com" created="Wed, 30 Sep 2015 07:25:06 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;OK - so are you saying that by default you would get the behavior that existed before &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-273&quot; title=&quot;EmailValidator does not support mailboxes at TLDs&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;VALIDATOR-273&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;VALIDATOR-273&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; was applied? If so, I agree with that. I ask because I think the fix that was applied there is going to actually break more applications than it helps.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14936643" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Wed, 30 Sep 2015 09:46:09 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Note that version 1.4.1 has already been released.&lt;br/&gt;
So reverting to previous behaviour would be a functional change, and needs to be very well documented if it is considered OK to do.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I am generally against adding network code to Validator runtime; that seems completely out of scope.&lt;br/&gt;
However it might be possible to add support for a user-provided callback to handle such cases.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;There&apos;s also the question of what the RFCs really say.&lt;br/&gt;
The example in &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-273&quot; title=&quot;EmailValidator does not support mailboxes at TLDs&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;VALIDATOR-273&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;VALIDATOR-273&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; used a country code, however the patch allowed all TLDs, including country-codes.&lt;br/&gt;
Was that correct? I had a brief look at RFC 5321 but the answer is not obvious.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Also, just because one or more mail apps do not work with addresses such as x.y@gmail does not mean that such addresses are invalid.&lt;br/&gt;
It&apos;s not unknown for mail apps to make unwarranted assumptions about the format of mail addresses.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14936722" author="ralph.goers@dslextreme.com" created="Wed, 30 Sep 2015 11:16:58 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;1. IMO the change in &lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-273&quot; title=&quot;EmailValidator does not support mailboxes at TLDs&quot; class=&quot;issue-link&quot; data-issue-key=&quot;VALIDATOR-273&quot;&gt;&lt;del&gt;VALIDATOR-273&lt;/del&gt;&lt;/a&gt; was a functional change and was not documented. What I am proposing is to revert the default behavior back so people can upgrade from old releases.&lt;br/&gt;
2. I shouldn&apos;t have said &quot;mail app&quot;. It isn&apos;t the mail apps but the smtp servers that are rejecting the email address. The mail apps do act a bit weird when this happens - in Mac mail I get a pop up that says the smtp server is unavailable and it asks me to try another. I know our exchange server is also refusing it but I don&apos;t know how that behaves.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14939210" author="ralph.goers@dslextreme.com" created="Thu, 1 Oct 2015 03:12:19 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I have created a patch that reverts the behavior for the default case but still allows the current behavior.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14942702" author="ralph.goers@dslextreme.com" created="Sun, 4 Oct 2015 16:29:34 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Has anyone reviewed the patch? I will assume it is OK for me to apply if I don&apos;t hear anything.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14942837" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Sun, 4 Oct 2015 22:28:18 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I think this change needs to be documented in changes.xml/ReleaseNotes.&lt;br/&gt;
Although it is reverting to previous behaviour it is still a functional change which could affect some people.&lt;br/&gt;
We failed to be explicit about the change previously; we should not repeat the mistake.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14942838" author="ralph.goers@dslextreme.com" created="Sun, 4 Oct 2015 22:33:44 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Two wrongs don&apos;t make a right &lt;img class=&quot;emoticon&quot; src=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/emoticons/wink.png&quot; height=&quot;16&quot; width=&quot;16&quot; align=&quot;absmiddle&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; border=&quot;0&quot;/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;That sounds reasonable to me.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14971068" author="britter" created="Fri, 23 Oct 2015 14:24:24 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=ralph_goers%40dslextreme.com&quot; class=&quot;user-hover&quot; rel=&quot;ralph_goers@dslextreme.com&quot;&gt;Ralph Goers&lt;/a&gt; go for it!&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14973066" author="ralph.goers@dslextreme.com" created="Sun, 25 Oct 2015 06:04:25 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The patch was applied and changes.xml updated.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-375] UrlValidator fails on IPv6 URL</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-375</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;I have created an UrlValidator:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt;[] schemes = {&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;http&quot;&lt;/span&gt;, &lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;https&quot;&lt;/span&gt;};
UrlValidator urlValidator = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; UrlValidator(schemes, UrlValidator.ALLOW_LOCAL_URLS);
urlValidator.isValid(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;https:&lt;span class=&quot;code-comment&quot;&gt;//[fe80::8e0:6afa:a2d5:1c8a]/myapp&quot;&lt;/span&gt;)&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;evaluates to false.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12875415">VALIDATOR-375</key>
            <summary>UrlValidator fails on IPv6 URL</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>

                            <comment id="14908434" author="jmsimpson68" created="Fri, 25 Sep 2015 18:08:01 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Same issue.  Would really like this one.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14908620" author="adrianc@hlmksw.com" created="Fri, 25 Sep 2015 20:21:44 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;This line is generating an empty host name string when an IPv6 address is used:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;        &lt;span class=&quot;code-object&quot;&gt;String&lt;/span&gt; hostLocation = authorityMatcher.group(PARSE_AUTHORITY_HOST_IP);
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;So, the regex is flawed. I&apos;m not a regex expert. If anyone can provide a patch for the regex, I will test it and commit it.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-373] Maven Shade plugin issuing depencency conflict for commons-beanutils and commons-collections </title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-373</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;After running mvn clean package we get the warning&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;WARNING&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; commons-beanutils-1.8.3.jar, commons-collections-3.2.1.jar define 10 overlappping classes:&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;WARNING&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; - org.apache.commons.collections.FastHashMap$EntrySet&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;WARNING&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; - org.apache.commons.collections.FastHashMap$KeySet&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;WARNING&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; - org.apache.commons.collections.FastHashMap$CollectionView$CollectionViewIterator&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;WARNING&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; - org.apache.commons.collections.ArrayStack&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;WARNING&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; - org.apache.commons.collections.FastHashMap$Values&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;WARNING&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; - org.apache.commons.collections.FastHashMap$CollectionView&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;WARNING&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; - org.apache.commons.collections.FastHashMap$1&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;WARNING&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; - org.apache.commons.collections.Buffer&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;WARNING&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; - org.apache.commons.collections.FastHashMap&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;span class=&quot;error&quot;&gt;&amp;#91;WARNING&amp;#93;&lt;/span&gt; - org.apache.commons.collections.BufferUnderflowException&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;this seems to be related to this issue:&lt;br/&gt;
&lt;a href=&quot;http://stackoverflow.com/questions/14402745/duplicate-classes-in-commons-collections-and-commons-beanutils&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://stackoverflow.com/questions/14402745/duplicate-classes-in-commons-collections-and-commons-beanutils&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;A workaround is to add an exclude to the pom but this should be fixed in commons-validator&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;&amp;lt;exclusions&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
  &amp;lt;exclusion&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
   &amp;lt;artifactId&amp;gt;commons-collections&amp;lt;/artifactId&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
   &amp;lt;groupId&amp;gt;commons-collections&amp;lt;/groupId&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
  &amp;lt;/exclusion&amp;gt;&lt;br/&gt;
 &amp;lt;/exclusions&amp;gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12856585">VALIDATOR-373</key>
            <summary>Maven Shade plugin issuing depencency conflict for commons-beanutils and commons-collections </summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>

            <title>[VALIDATOR-369] DateValidatorTest.testCompare() fails with GMT-12</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-369</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;There is a test failure when the system timezone is set to GMT-12:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;Tests run: 8, Failures: 1, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 0.02 sec &amp;lt;&amp;lt;&amp;lt; FAILURE! - in org.apache.commons.validator.routines.DateValidatorTest
testCompare(org.apache.commons.validator.routines.DateValidatorTest)  Time elapsed: 0.004 sec  &amp;lt;&amp;lt;&amp;lt; FAILURE!
junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: date EQ expected:&amp;lt;0&amp;gt; but was:&amp;lt;1&amp;gt;
        at junit.framework.Assert.fail(Assert.java:57)
        at junit.framework.Assert.failNotEquals(Assert.java:329)
        at junit.framework.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:78)
        at junit.framework.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:234)
        at junit.framework.TestCase.assertEquals(TestCase.java:401)
        at org.apache.commons.validator.routines.DateValidatorTest.testCompare(DateValidatorTest.java:126)

&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12836807">VALIDATOR-369</key>
            <summary>DateValidatorTest.testCompare() fails with GMT-12</summary>

                            <comment id="14992700" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Thu, 5 Nov 2015 23:25:53 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Countries using GMT-12:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Baker Island: an uninhabited atoll located just north of the equator in the central Pacific Ocean about 3,100 kilometres (1,900 miles) southwest of Honolulu. - &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;See more at: &lt;a href=&quot;http://wwp.greenwichmeantime.com/time-zone/gmt-12/&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://wwp.greenwichmeantime.com/time-zone/gmt-12/&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Which might explain why it has not previously been reported!&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14992711" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Thu, 5 Nov 2015 23:32:18 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Note that GMT+1115 and above also cause the problem.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14992729" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Thu, 5 Nov 2015 23:47:32 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;The tests were doing comparisons of GMT dates with the default Timezone.&lt;br/&gt;
Not sure that makes sense, so changed the tests to use GMT for the comparisons.&lt;/p&gt;

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-367] TLD list of DomainValidator is out of date (159 of 947 not available)</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-367</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;TLD list of DomainValidator is out of date.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;159 new TLDs out of 947 are not available in DomainValidator. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Until such time as a better method is implemented, adding new entries from  &lt;a href=&quot;http://data.iana.org/TLD/tlds-alpha-by-domain.txt&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://data.iana.org/TLD/tlds-alpha-by-domain.txt&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;Main reason for creating this issue is that unavailability of relevant TLDs result in 16% failure in a local parameterised unit test, which tests against email addressed from all possible TLDs.&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12833456">VALIDATOR-367</key>
            <summary>TLD list of DomainValidator is out of date (159 of 947 not available)</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="ayomawdb">Ayoma Wijethunga</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 28 May 2015 15:14:36 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 27 Jul 2020 15:17:28 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Thu, 4 Jun 2015 12:28:11 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>1.4.1 Release</version>
                                    <fixVersion>1.5.0</fixVersion>
                                    <component>Routines</component>
                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>2</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="14563045" author="ayomawdb" created="Thu, 28 May 2015 15:17:09 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Patch for DomainValidator.java is attached, which updates latest TLDs.&lt;/p&gt;


&lt;p&gt;Please note that the is my first contribution towards Apache Commons. Hence, kindly let me know if I have done anything wrong in the bug report.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14566108" author="garydgregory" created="Sat, 30 May 2015 17:19:28 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Welcome to Apache Commons!&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Unless trivial, a patch is best accompanied by a unit test. Since I am not an SME in this component, I wonder if this update needs an update to unit tests.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;You should also run a Maven build for to make sure the patch does not cause any regressions and say so. &quot;If ran &apos;mvn test&apos; and got no errors&quot; or the same with &apos;mvn site&apos; or &apos;mvn package&apos; it depends on the patch. Running a full build with &apos;mvn site&apos; usually does not take long and lets you check for FindBugs, PMD, Cllirr, RAT, and Checktyle issues in the site&apos;s reports section. Note that not all projects are set up with the same reports.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;I won&apos;t apply this patch myself now but let someone who is closer to the component do so.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thank you!&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14566128" author="ayomawdb" created="Sat, 30 May 2015 18:14:13 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Thank you so much for your valuable comment and guidelines.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;mvn test completes with : &lt;br/&gt;
   Tests run: 446, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0&lt;br/&gt;
and  &apos;mvn site&apos; and &apos;mvn package&apos; completes without any error.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Actually, as I am not adding any new methods or logic, but updating only the static TLD list to latest. Therefore, no change was done in unit tests. I believe no change is necessary in unit tests as the test coverage was not affected by the change (verified with Cobertura). &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Thank you again for your support and guidelines provided. It surely was helpful as a fresh contributor towards Apache.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="14572681" author="sebb@apache.org" created="Thu, 4 Jun 2015 12:28:11 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;URL: &lt;a href=&quot;http://svn.apache.org/r1683531&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;http://svn.apache.org/r1683531&lt;/a&gt;&lt;br/&gt;

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-365] An arbitrarily large email string causes stackoverflowerror in EmailValidator.isValid()</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-365</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;RFC-3696 defines a limit to the length of an email address. The local part is limited to 64 characters. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Providing an arbitrarily long local segment to a string that is passed to EmailValidator.isValid() can cause the function to overflow the stack. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;div class=&quot;code panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;codeContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre class=&quot;code-java&quot;&gt;groovy:000&amp;gt; test = &lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;new&lt;/span&gt; EmailValidator(&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;false&lt;/span&gt;)
===&amp;gt; org.apache.commons.validator.routines.EmailValidator@2256a2bd
groovy:000&amp;gt; test.isValid(&lt;span class=&quot;code-quote&quot;&gt;&quot;Loremipsumdolorsitametconsecteturadipiscingelit.Nullavitaeligulamattisrhoncusnuncegestasmattisleo.Donecnonsapieninmagnatristiquedictumaacturpis.Fusceorciduifacilisisutsapieneuconsequatpharetralectus.Quisqueenimestpulvinarutquamvitaeportamattisex.Nullamquismaurisplaceratconvallisjustoquisportamauris.Innullalacusconvalliseufringillautvenenatissitametdiam.Maecenasluctusligulascelerisquepulvinarfeugiat.Sedmolestienullaaliquetorciluctusidpharetranislfinibus.Suspendissemalesuadatinciduntduisitametportaarcusollicitudinnec.Donecetmassamagna.Curabitururnadiampretiumveldignissimporttitorfringillaeuneque.Duisantetelluspharetraidtinciduntinterdummolestiesitametfelis.Utquisquamsitametantesagittisdapibusacnonodio.Namrutrummolestiediamidmattis.Cumsociisnatoquepenatibusetmagnisdisparturientmontesnasceturridiculusmus.Morbiposueresedmetusacconsectetur.Etiamquisipsumvitaejustotempusmaximus.Sedultriciesplaceratvolutpat.Integerlacuslectusmaximusacornarequissagittissitametjusto.Cumsociisnatoquepenatibusetmagnisdisparturientmontesnasceturridiculusmus.Maecenasindictumpurussedrutrumex.Nullafacilisi.Integerfinibusfinibusmietpharetranislfaucibusvel.Maecenasegetdolorlacinialobortisjustovelullamcorpersem.Vivamusaliquetpurusidvariusornaresapienrisusrutrumnisitinciduntmollissemnequeidmetus.Etiamquiseleifendpurus.Nuncfelisnuncscelerisqueiddignissimnecfinibusalibero.Nuncsemperenimnequesitamethendreritpurusfacilisisac.Maurisdapibussemperfelisdignissimgravida.Aeneanultricesblanditnequealiquamfinibusodioscelerisqueac.Aliquamnecmassaeumaurisfaucibusfringilla.Etiamconsequatligulanisisitametaliquamnibhtemporquis.Nuncinterdumdignissimnullaatsodalesarcusagittiseu.Proinpharetrametusneclacuspulvinarsedvolutpatliberoornare.Sedligulanislpulvinarnonlectuseublanditfacilisisante.Sedmollisnislalacusauctorsuscipit.Inhachabitasseplateadictumst.Phasellussitametvelittemporvenenatisfeliseuegestasrisus.Aliquameteratsitametnibhcommodofinibus.Morbiefficiturodiovelpulvinariaculis.Aeneantemporipsummassaaconsecteturturpisfaucibusultrices.Praesentsodalesmaurisquisportafermentum.Etiamnisinislvenenatisvelauctorutullamcorperinjusto.Proinvelligulaerat.Phasellusvestibulumgravidamassanonfeugiat.Maecenaspharetraeuismodmetusegetefficitur.Suspendisseamet@gmail.com&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);
ERROR java.lang.StackOverflowError:
&lt;span class=&quot;code-keyword&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This is using commons-validator 1.4.1. &lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12821285">VALIDATOR-365</key>
            <summary>An arbitrarily large email string causes stackoverflowerror in EmailValidator.isValid()</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-364] Email Validator does not support quoted/escaped character in the local part of the email address</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-364</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Currently the email address validator doesn&apos;t support to quote (or escape) a character in the local part of the address.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Examples:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;preformatted panel&quot; style=&quot;border-width: 1px;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;preformattedContent panelContent&quot;&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;Abc\@def@example.com
Fred\ Bloggs@example.com
Joe.\\Blow@example.com
&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Source: &lt;a href=&quot;http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3696#section-3&quot; class=&quot;external-link&quot; rel=&quot;nofollow&quot;&gt;RFC 3696 &lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment></environment>
        <key id="12784840">VALIDATOR-364</key>
            <summary>Email Validator does not support quoted/escaped character in the local part of the email address</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="5" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/resolved.png" description="A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.">Resolved</status>
