<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-84] Serialization problem with org.apache.commons.validator.ValidatorResult$ResultStatu</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-84</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;org.apache.struts.validator.DynaValidatorForm serialisation fails because &lt;br/&gt;
class org.apache.commons.validator.ValidatorResult$ResultStatus does not &lt;br/&gt;
implement interface Serializable.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;This is not consistent with other classes of Validator or Struts, so I believe &lt;br/&gt;
it&apos;s a bug.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The correction consists in modifying file ValidatorResult.java at line 132 and &lt;br/&gt;
replacing code:&lt;br/&gt;
protected class ResultStatus {&lt;br/&gt;
by:&lt;br/&gt;
protected class ResultStatus implements Serializable {&lt;/p&gt;</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: All&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: All&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12340421">VALIDATOR-84</key>
            <summary>Serialization problem with org.apache.commons.validator.ValidatorResult$ResultStatu</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="pierre.chardin@axa.com">Pierre Chardin</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Fri, 15 Nov 2002 21:54:49 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:09 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Wed, 19 Jul 2006 14:08:59 +0000</resolved>
                                    <version>Nightly Builds</version>
                                    <fixVersion>1.1.0 (alpha)</fixVersion>
                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>1</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
                                                                <comments>
                            <comment id="12403243" author="martinc" created="Tue, 3 Dec 2002 12:53:03 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Unfortunately, I don&apos;t believe the fix is quite that simple. The problem is &lt;br/&gt;
that ValidatorResult$ResultStatus contains an Object reference, and as far as I &lt;br/&gt;
can determine, that object can be anything at all. Therefore, although we could &lt;br/&gt;
mark ValidatorResult$ResultStatus as implementing Serializable, it would not be &lt;br/&gt;
truly serializable unless all of the validation methods returned serializable &lt;br/&gt;
objects.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;It&apos;s not clear to me what we should do about this - it needs the attention of &lt;br/&gt;
someone more familiar with the details of the Validator than I am.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12403244" author="turner@blackbear.com" created="Thu, 12 Dec 2002 14:44:42 +0000"  >
&lt;p&gt;My feeling on this is that:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;To date, all validator rules in Apache source either return a boolean &lt;br/&gt;
(pass/fail) or a Serializable type (Date, Long, etc).  Therefore, in the &lt;br/&gt;
interest of fixing this problem, I think we should declare that the type of &lt;br/&gt;
any object returned by a validation rule must implement Serializable, and add &lt;br/&gt;
Serializable to the subclass.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Any objections?&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12403245" author="pierre.chardin@axa.com" created="Thu, 12 Dec 2002 18:48:12 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;I have no objections.&lt;/p&gt;

</comment>
                            <comment id="12403246" author="martinc" created="Sun, 15 Dec 2002 15:17:15 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Fixed in the 20021213 nightly build.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;ValidatorResult$ResultStatus now implements Serializable. The onus is therefore &lt;br/&gt;
on the Validator client to ensure that result classes are serializable.&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                            <comment id="12422141" author="niallp" created="Wed, 19 Jul 2006 14:08:59 +0000"  >&lt;p&gt;Re-openned and the set to &quot;Resolved Fixed&quot; again to correct &quot;resolution&quot; which was lost in Bugzilla --&amp;gt; JIRA conversion&lt;/p&gt;</comment>
                    </comments>
                    <attachments>
                    </attachments>
                <subtasks>
                    </subtasks>

<item>
            <title>[VALIDATOR-83] Cannot use same name for field and validator, validator is never invoked</title>
                <link>https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VALIDATOR-83</link>
                <project id="12310494" key="VALIDATOR">Commons Validator</project>
                    <description>&lt;p&gt;Cannot use same name for field and validator, validator is never invoked. &lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;The bug is in Validator.validateFieldForRule&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;	if (results.getValidatorResult(va.getName()) != null) &lt;/p&gt;
{
	    return isValid(results.getValidatorResult(va.getName()));
	}

&lt;p&gt;ValidatorResults.getValidatorResult expects a field key not the validator name. &lt;br/&gt;
Here is the fix:&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;        if (results.getValidatorResult(field.getKey()) != null) &lt;/p&gt;
{
            ValidatorResult result = results.getValidatorResult(field.getKey());
            if (result.containsAction(va.getName()))
	      return result.isValid(va.getName());
	}</description>
                <environment>&lt;p&gt;Operating System: other&lt;br/&gt;
Platform: Other&lt;/p&gt;</environment>
        <key id="12340384">VALIDATOR-83</key>
            <summary>Cannot use same name for field and validator, validator is never invoked</summary>
                <type id="1" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/viewavatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=21133&amp;avatarType=issuetype">Bug</type>
                                            <priority id="3" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/priorities/major.svg">Major</priority>
                        <status id="6" iconUrl="https://issues.apache.org/jira/images/icons/statuses/closed.png" description="The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.">Closed</status>
                    <statusCategory id="3" key="done" colorName="green"/>
                                    <resolution id="1">Fixed</resolution>
                                        <assignee username="-1">Unassigned</assignee>
                                    <reporter username="padma.ginnaram@s1.com">Padma Ginnaram</reporter>
                        <labels>
                    </labels>
                <created>Thu, 24 Oct 2002 22:30:19 +0000</created>
                <updated>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:09 +0000</updated>
                            <resolved>Mon, 12 Nov 2007 19:25:09 +0000</resolved>
                                                                        <due></due>
                            <votes>0</votes>
                                    <watches>0</watches>
